memberdef.argsstring: (Callable[[ArrayLike], float] fun, Optional[Bounds] bounds=None, Optional[ArrayLike] x0=None, Optional[Union[float, ArrayLike, Callable]] input_sigma=0.3, Optional[int] popsize=31, Optional[int] max_evaluations=100000, Optional[int] max_iterations=100000, Optional[int] workers=1, Optional[float] accuracy=1.0, Optional[float] stop_fitness=-np.inf, Optional[Callable[[ArrayLike, float], bool]] is_terminate=None, Optional[Generator] rg=Generator(PCG64DXSM()), Optional[int] runid=0, Optional[bool] normalize=True, Optional[int] update_gap=None)
memberdef.name: minimize

briefdescription.para: Minimizes a scalar function using the Covariance Matrix Adaptation Evolution Strategy (CMA-ES) algorithm.

detaileddescription.para: This function is designed to handle optimization tasks for non-linear, non-convex, and possibly noisy objective functions. It supports parallel execution via workers, normalization of the input search space, and adaptive stopping criteria based on given conditions.

para.verbatim: fun (Callable[[ArrayLike], float]): The objective function to be minimized. It should take an input array and return a scalar value.

parameterdescription.para: The lower and upper bounds for the search space. If None, the search space is considered unbounded.

Initial solution guess. If None, an initial guess will be generated randomly. input_sigma (Optional[Union[float, ArrayLike, Callable]]): The initial standard deviation for the sampling. Can be float, array, or callable.
The population size for the CMA-ES algorithm. Defaults to 31.
Maximum number of function evaluations allowed. Defaults to 100,000.
Maximum number of iterations allowed for the algorithm. Defaults to 100,000.
Number of parallel processes to be used. If set to 1 or less, the algorithm will run in serial mode. Defaults to 1.
The accuracy tolerance used to adjust the optimization stopping criteria. Defaults to 1.0.

Objective function value at which the optimization process is terminated if reached. Defaults to -infinity. is_terminate (Optional[Callable[[ArrayLike, float], bool]]): Custom termination condition provided as a callable. Defaults to None.
The random number generator to be used. Defaults to Generator(PCG64DXSM()).
Identifier for the optimization run. Defaults to 0.
Indicates if the search space should be normalized. Defaults to True.
Interval for delayed updates in the algorithm. If None, updates are not delayed.

simplesect.para: OptimizeResult Object containing the results of the optimization. Includes the optimized solution (x), the minimized function value (fun), number of function evaluations (nfev), number of iterations (nit), algorithm exit status (status), and success flag (success).

listitem.para: This module implements the Covariance Matrix Adaptation Evolution Strategy (CMA-ES) for optimization tasks. It provides a framework for minimizing scalar functions using evolutionary strategies, with support for parallel execution and adaptive stopping criteria.
The implementation is based on the original CMA-ES algorithm and has been optimized for performance using NumPy and SciPy libraries.
